fields.description: As a user of the Eucalyptus Management Console I would like a simple interface to manage the metadata for an object in S3/ObjectStore so that I don't need to use a command-line interface to perform those updates.

comments.body: Need to test the object metadata editor with an updated Eucalyptus 4.1 build after EUCA-9948 has been implemented in the back-end.  There shouldn't be additional work required on the console side, since the metadata appears to work with AWS.
Looking at the blocker, there are no commits and it's in "confirmed" state, so I wouldn't expect it to be fixed till both of those things change. I'll make sure Tony's aware.
Thanks, everyone. Looks like [~wwannemacher] has taken it and it's in progress now. Yay!

Here's the info on what's installed on 10.111.5.150
package info:
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.1.0
Release     : 0.0.22769.223.20141118git6ce60ce.el6

repo URL is: baseurl=http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/eucalyptus-devel/rhel/6/x86_64/

at that URL:
[   ]	eucalyptus-4.1.0-0.0.22769.223.20141118git6ce60ce.el6.x86_64.rpm	18-Nov-2014 10:40	102K


here's the commit we were hoping to test:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/c2246dbeefd1bc5670dc8dc5167f31413c5082d6

[~kgill] It looks like that was merged on the 17th. Package was built on the 18th. If it doesn't work, I'd connect with [~wwannemacher] for some follow up.
[~dkavanagh]: Could you give me a heads up when the dev cloud has been updated with the latest EUCA-9948 fixes?

I did a test where I set "Content-Language" to "en_us".

Here are the request headers:
2014-11-24 17:06:32,902 boto [DEBUG]:Headers: {'x-amz-metadata-directive': 'REPLACE', 'Content-Type': u'image/jpeg', u'x-amz-meta-Content-Language': u'en_us', 'x-amz-copy-source': 'newbucket/IMG_20140506_084716.jpg', 'x-amz-storage-class': 'STANDARD'}
and signed string:
PUT

image/jpeg
Mon, 24 Nov 2014 22:19:45 GMT
x-amz-copy-source:newbucket/IMG_20140506_084716.jpg
x-amz-meta-content-language:en_us
x-amz-metadata-directive:REPLACE
x-amz-security-token:ZXVjYQABIBXYsegNzHBKoMH1tVlrbA3eIGJI4rhZG/QMFKMsBA1Ly9/BihPvaS/hRE93zce5I8hqG4h+wAgL8M+hKF9M4CwwM8wd7TvkVPK4DZMBRLto7NIbZGg71LGqWiK5GCQsB46dVzcydYh40Moi6Umb8H5znpqWiv/U4pfR0uMifjGetqGCFm7YP/bShfada4lXKErnedXLebLOepYgCpx/yXqXGROFxRiEB1kR1x+8hIFUeE2pOcMz6sA=
x-amz-storage-class:STANDARD
/services/objectstorage/newbucket/IMG_20140506_084716.jpg

and response:
2014-11-24 17:06:33,412 boto [DEBUG]:Data: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><AccessControlPolicy xmlns="http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/"><Owner><ID>45c5d5521361a10353e514f4f3219554e455a2152059441611304e05e3c61193</ID><DisplayName>ui-test-acct-00</DisplayName></Owner><AccessControlList><Grant><Grantee xsi:type="Group" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"><URI>http://acs.amazonaws.com/groups/global/AllUsers</URI></Grantee><Permission>FULL_CONTROL</Permission></Grant><Grant><Grantee xsi:type="CanonicalUser" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"><ID>45c5d5521361a10353e514f4f3219554e455a2152059441611304e05e3c61193</ID><DisplayName>ui-test-acct-00</DisplayName></Grantee><Permission>FULL_CONTROL</Permission></Grant></AccessControlList></AccessControlPolicy>

It's odd, because I expected a <CopyObjectResult>, but AMZ returns the same XML.
[~wwannemacher], probably should have commented on the EUCA ticket, but take a look here. Anything else I can do to help test/verify this?

In testing,
initially setting "cache-control" to "no-store" doesn't take on upload. It looks like upload doesn't gather the proper header information that the metadata editor provides. It also seems like we can't modify the standard headers (like Content-Disposition, Cache-Control) after the object is uploaded.
In addition, [~wwannemacher] mentioned in e-mail that the standard headers (like those listed above) should be working and that user metadata (sent in x-amz-meta-* headers) likely isn't working on euca.
(for use later: >>> s3 = boto.connect_walrus(host="10.111.5.150", aws_access_key_id="access", aws_secret_access_key="secret", path="/services/objectstorage", is_secure=True, debug=2)
)

I'm still not able to set either standard headers or custom metadata. I tried both on object create and copy. [~wwannemacher], I'm using a really recent nightly package build: 0.0.22816.240.20141124git0458434.el6
[~dkavanagh] - can you point me to your test cloud?
[~dkavanagh] we are waiting for new packages to be built. My changes for this did not go in until two days after the date on those packages.

I should apologize. I saw that the eucaconsole package was newer here: http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/eucalyptus-devel/rhel/6/x86_64/
and didn't think to check about the back end packages, which I can now see are older. I'll look for those to be updated before I update and check this again.
I've verified that this behaves the same as it does on AWS (with a few tests that I did). Our current dev team server has the latest code.
already merged to develop as part of some other PR.

This mostly worked. I tested different provided keys and my own arbitrary key. The one that failed was "Content-Language". It worked against AWS, but not Eucalyptus. [~wwannemacher], do you know if this one is handled like the other standard values like "Content-Type"?

[~dkavanagh] according to the docs here - http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTObjectPUT.html it wouldn't be handled like Content-Type. Meaning, you could set x-amz-meta-content-language and then see x-amz-meta-content-language on the response. However, if setting Content-Language works against S3, that just means the docs are wrong. I'd prefer to track it as a separate ticket though, if we're going to support it. I can file it or you can...

[~wwannemacher], the content-language value comes back as lower case with aws, so perhaps it is handled as user metadata. I'll capture the request headers and include that on a new ticket.
Looks like a case issue, see the description.
https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-10248

I'm going to move this ticket into QA again.
A back end issue was identified as a minor AWS incompatibility issue, so I'm going to approve this ticket.
